result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa M Boner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time as determined by the agent.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.   Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
No contact with any Piggly Wiggly Stores. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lisa M Boner in court with attorney Erika Lynn Moore.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Matter is resolved.
State does not have proper victim notification.
Plea - Ct.1 - NC.
BTC: Ct.1 - GUILTY.    Ct.2 - DRI.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lisa M Boner in court with attorney Erika Lynn Moore.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
State has extended a global offer.
Def needs time to go over the offer with the deft.
BTC: Matter adjourned, deft to go to ZCI after court.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim store Piggly Wiggly for any Piggly Wiggly Store except for restitution purposes.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Lisa M Boner in court with attorney Erika Lynn Moore.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Status conference scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Pre-Trial Conference and Order/case adjourned off the record.
Restitution request - provided by Victim Witness.  AM..NO AMOUNT GIVEN
